p:metadata.p:property:
PEKKAHOME.PEKKA IO domain controller at Pekka's house.
Memory blocks are IN.GARAGE.PEKKA, OUT.GARAGE.PEKKA, FLASH_UP.GARAGE.PEKKA.... IN.GRUMPYBORG.PEKKA, OUT.GRUMPYBORG.PEKKA
Accepts only client certificates signed by Pekka.

font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-weight: normal; font-style: normal; text-decoration: none; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0); fill-opacity: 1;
text.tspan: IO domain controller at Pekka's house.

p:metadata.p:property:
GARAGE.PEKKA - "garageio" IO device. Monitors/controls garage door and lights. "garageio" is name of the application and MYGARAGE is name of particulat
Memory blocks IN, OUT, INFO, FLASH_UP, FLASH_DOWN, CONF_UP, CONF_DOWN
IO device = process, "GARAGE" is name for and instance of "garageio".

Memory blocks IN, OUT, CAMERA, INFO, FLASH_UP, FLASH_DOWN, CONF_UP, CONF_DOWN

p:metadata.p:property:
SMOKY.SMOKECLOUD IO domain controller, for example in Amazon cloud.
Memory blocks are IN.GARAGE.PEKKA, OUT.GARAGE.PEKKA ... CAMERA.SPYCAM.PEKKA... CAMERA.SKYEYE.MARKKU...
Accepts client certificates signed by Smokecloud or signed by entity certified by Smokecloud. Knows that PEKKA and MARKKU are "users", and holds information to verify the passwords

p:metadata.p:property:
MARKKUHOME.MARKKU - "iodomain" IO controller.
Memory blocks are IN.SKYEYE.MARKKU, OUT.SKYEYE.MARKKU, FLASH_UP.SKYEYE.MARKKU...
Accepts only client certificates signed by Markku.

p:metadata.p:property:
SKYEYE.MARKKU - "telescope" IO device. Conrols this big looking glass to see the sky and shows pictures from it
Memory blocks IN, OUT, CAMERA, INFO, FLASH_UP, FLASH_DOWN, CONF_UP, CONF_DOWN

p:metadata.p:property:
Transport level security is based on server and client certificates, and that user name (PEKKA or MARKKU) and password are accepted by the IO domain controller. Here term "user name" is the same as name of a device network owned by an entity like a person or business.
This provides device level security within user's network. This means that all transport is encrypted and each device is reliably identified.
Fine tuning security is to real user level is not task of IOCOM. For example that person Sofie is allowed to control house temperature but Tijana is not doesn't belong to IOCOM, it knows nothing about Tijana or Sofie. If this is needed, it is to be implemented at higher level. By default SMOKECLOUD will not pass any data between PEKKA and MARKKU device networks.
Efficiency note: We may want to move any unused connections to almost paused "slow" mode. This would prevent analog inputs, etc noisy sources from creating unnecessary network load.

server and client certificates, and that
password are accepted by the IO

p:metadata.p:property:
SPYCAM.PEKKA - "spycam" IO device. A device attached to wifes car to monitor safe driving behaviour.
Memory blocks IN, OUT, CAMERA, INFO, FLASH_UP, FLASH_DOWN, CONF_UP, CONF_DOWN

rect.style: stroke-linejoin: round; stroke: rgb(102, 102, 102); stroke-opacity: 1; stroke-width: 2; fill: rgb(189, 223, 255); fill-opacity: 1;

p:metadata.p:property:
Each box or circle in the picture represents a process. Curved lines in between are TLS sockets, pointing from client to server.
Smokecloud is the overlord, who delivers the systems, one to Pekka, other to Markku. Smokecloud authorizes both Pekka and Markku to certidy their devices.
If instead of household, like Pekka, the user is large business, etc, we would use "VARKAUS.MIGHTYCORP" instead of "PEKKA" and add one layer to the chain of trust.
